snippet: At an annual conference, mayors said that despite Washington’s profound inaction they have managed to shrink deficits, increase property values and create new jobs in their cities.
abstract: Mayors from across the country convene at their annual conference in Orlando, Fla, and say that despite Washington's profound inaction they have managed to shrink deficits, increase property values and create new jobs in their cities; many of them express frustration about political gridlock that has paralyzed Congress.
lead_paragraph: At an annual conference, mayors said that despite Washington’s profound inaction they have managed to shrink deficits, increase property values and create new jobs in their cities.

headline.seo: Mayors See Slight Gains, No Thanks to Congress
headline.main: Mayors See Slight Gains, No Thanks to Congress
headline.print_headline: Mayors See Slight Gains, No Thanks To Congress
